title: How Revolve Maximized Their Global Authorization Rates  With Reach
excerpt: Revolve, a Los Angeles-based online fashion retailer, partnered with Reach to improve their international payment authorization rates, achieving a 12% increase in their weighted average global authorization rate while simplifying their global operations.

blocks.text: Revolve, a Los Angeles-based online fashion retailer, has carved their niche as a global leader in trendsetting apparel. With customers spanning continents, the company faced a pivotal challenge: improving international payment authorization rates to enhance the customer experience and drive revenue.

stats.description: increased Revolve's weighted average global authorization rate
removed the need for Revolve to establish local business entities worldwide
scaled operations & offerings in multiple regions with a single integration and contract
an eight-year collaboration built on trust and mutual success

blocks.quote: "Reach really acts as an extension of my team. They help us improve our authorization rates. For example, if we see a lower authorization rate in Taiwan, there's going to be an active discussion between us and Reach to work to improve it. Typically, it's Reach coming up with solutions and recommendations for us."
blocks.citation: Kai Li - Senior Vice President of International, Revolve

blocks.text: The Situation

When Kai Li joined Revolve, he was tasked with scaling the company's international operations. One significant hurdle was ensuring high authorization rates for transactions across diverse global markets. In cross-border ecommerce, international transactions are often flagged as potential fraud by banks, leading to false declines and lost revenue. Revolve needed a global solution that could improve authorization rates while simplifying the complexity of operating in multiple countries worldwide. Revolve was, at the time, constrained by engineering resources, meaning that they could only afford to integrate a payment partner into their systems once every few years. Therefore, they had to be very cautious with who they chose to help them with their global expansion.
The Solution
In 2016, Revolve chose Reach as its Merchant of Record. The decision was rooted in Reach's ability to localize transactions seamlessly through this powerful model. Key features included:
Single Integration & Contract

Reach eliminated the need for Revolve to establish multiple local business entities worldwide by allowing them to use Reach's existing global entity network. Revolve also unlocked a vast suite of preferred local payment methods through the singular integration process.
Localized Payments
Reach's global network enabled transactions to be processed locally in the customer's banking region, which dramatically improved Revolve's authorization rates worldwide.
Global Expertise
Reach provided the experience and knowledge of international payments Revolve needed without them having to onboard additional teams or specialists.
Transparent Operations
Unlike competitors, Reach clearly outlined all requirements and processes from the outset, ensuring a frictionless collaboration for years to come.

blocks.heading: The Outcome
blocks.text:
Reach's single integration and single contract approach allowed Revolve to operate worldwide without cross-border administrative burdens.

Through Reach, Revolve was able to avoid the overhead costs of hiring additional teams to handle their international payments internally.

By localizing transactions, Reach significantly improved Revolve's authorization rates, directly boosting global revenue.

Eight years into the partnership, Reach remains Revolve's primary global payments partner thanks to constant collaboration, discussion, and growth.

meta.title: How Revolve Maximized Their Global Authorization Rates With Reach | Reach
meta.description: Discover how Revolve partnered with Reach to improve their global authorization rates and simplify international operations.

title: SaberMasters overcomes payment challenges & achieves record-breaking growth.
companyName: SaberMasters is a growing e-commerce company selling premium lightsabers to the global Star Wars community. While they gained traction quickly through social media and selling on Shopify
excerpt: From September to December 2023, SaberMasters generated over $1.4 million in sales, marking their most successful and peaceful Q4 yet. By leveraging Reach's Merchant of Record model and ease of integration, SaberMasters could concentrate on expanding their business without the stress of international payment concerns.

blocks.text: SaberMasters is a growing e-commerce company selling premium lightsabers to the global Star Wars community. While they gained traction quickly through social media and selling on Shopify, they encountered significant payment processing issues that threatened their expansion.

stats.description: from September to December 2023
Achieved best & most peaceful Q4 to date
Improved conversion & authorization rates
Integrated a scalable payments infrastructure

blocks.quote: "Through Reach, we were able to get back on track, and we saw an increase in conversion rates and authorization rates."

blocks.text: The Situation

Heading into Q4 2023, SaberMasters was in a difficult situation with over $80,000 in held funds. This is because they had to create new merchant accounts separate from the ones used by their previous business, which caused them to lose credibility, even after processing millions in revenue through their former processor. To further the problem, SaberMasters was limited by the lack of credit card options they had in Europe, which restricted their working capital and their overall ability to scale in the region. According to Blagovest Kamenov, Co-Founder and former CMO at SaberMasters, the team faced a situation where "there was pretty much no exit," putting their business at risk during the critical holiday season.
The Solution

In September 2023, SaberMasters partnered with Reach to leverage their Merchant of Record model to power their global sales. Through Reach's ability to plug into SaberMaster's existing Shopify expansion stores with a simple no-code integration, the onboarding process was smooth, allowing SaberMasters to swiftly resolve the issues experienced with their former payment processor. Reach gave them access to the liquidity they needed, which was a game-changer during their most important sales period of the year.

From September to December 2023, SaberMasters generated over $1.4 million in sales, marking their most successful and peaceful Q4 yet. By leveraging Reach's Merchant of Record model and ease of integration, SaberMasters could concentrate on expanding their business without the stress of international payment concerns.

blocks.heading: The Outcome
blocks.text:
Processing locally through Reach empowered SaberMasters to surpass $1.4 million in sales during Q4 2023, marking their highest revenue period to date. SaberMaster's conversion and authorization rates improved due to Reach's Merchant of Record model & local processing ability.

Reach provided SaberMasters with a reliable and secure global payment system, ensuring they had the liquidity they needed to scale their operations. By optimizing their global payment systems SaberMasters was able to shift their focus from managing international payment risks to driving growth.

Through Reach's embedded Shopify integrations, SaberMasters was able to optimize their international payments quickly and without any technical lift. They were live and able to capture revenue right away with a no-code integration, just in time for the holiday season.

blocks.quote: "Reach really has been that rock for us. It lets us focus on how to better serve and interact with our customers, knowing that the payment side is handled — and handled well."

blocks.text: The Situation

In the early nineties, Sideshow relied on phone and fax orders. As they expanded online, more customers began shopping from abroad, but the checkout experience created friction for international buyers. Before partnering with Reach, Sideshow only accepted credit cards, lacked localized payment options, and processed all transactions from the U.S., leading to high foreign transaction fees, and false declines - these issues deterred global customers. Sideshow was also limited by the standard refund policies available through previous payment service providers. These policies did not fit Sideshow's pre-order-based business model in a way that satisfied their global consumer's needs. To maintain their reputation for exceptional experiences, Sideshow needed a solution that aligned with their premium products and met the needs of their diverse audience.
The Solution

In 2014, Sideshow partnered with Reach to level up their international ecommerce capabilities. Reach, through their Merchant of Record (MoR) model, greatly improved Sideshow's checkout in all the countries they serve. This allowed Sideshow to:
Localize Their Checkout Experience
Enable cross-border customers to pay via payment methods & currencies local to, or preferred by them.
Reduce Cross-Border Fees
Significantly reduce cross-border transaction fees for their international customers.
Reduce Purchase Friction
Streamline the checkout process to reduce friction and enhance the buying experience for their global audience.
Custom-Build Collaborative Solutions
Regular collaboration with developers at both companies provided Sideshow with bespoke solutions to the pre-order refund challenges inherent to their industry and product.

blocks.heading: The Outcome
blocks.text:
Sideshow unlocked a localized checkout, which led to a worldwide average approval rate of 92.60% and a significant decrease in failed transactions.

Reach minimized or eliminated international transaction fees, creating a better experience for customers and boosting conversions.

Sideshow's customers gained the convenience of paying in their local currencies & payment methods, eliminating checkout friction and increasing their overall satisfaction.

With Reach managing the complexities of global payments, Sideshow can focus on growing its product offerings and strengthening customer relationships.

title: How The Foldie Scaled Global Success with Reach
companyName: Founded in 2020 by siblings Thomas and Svéa Van den Heuvel
excerpt: The Foldie unlocked hassle-free international payments, global tax compliance, and fraud prevention through Reach's Merchant of Record model. By leveraging Reach's no-code Shopify integration, The Foldie achieved 10,000 orders each in the UK and Australia within months of implementation while significantly reducing customer complaints and chargebacks.

blocks.text: Founded in 2020 by siblings Thomas and Svéa Van den Heuvel, The Foldie began as an innovative response to the rising demand for versatile travel products. Their flagship offering—foldable travel bags—not only met the needs of modern travellers but also propelled the company to rapid success in the U.S. However, as The Foldie's reputation grew, it became evident that lucrative markets beyond American borders remained untapped.

stats.description: each in the UK and Australia within months of implementation
with international payments, global tax compliance, & fraud prevention
with significantly reduced customer complaints and chargebacks
by redistributing stock globally to align with seasonal demand

blocks.quote: "With Reach, it's easy to get into other countries, and it doesn't take a lot of effort from the founders. Having those extra hands feels like a part of the business you can just give away to someone else. And that's really game-changing for us."
blocks.citation: Svéa Van den Heuvel - Co-Founder, The Foldie

blocks.quote: "With Reach, it's super simple to add another 10-30% on top of your current revenue. It has been a game-changer."
blocks.citation: Thomas Van den Heuvel - Co-Founder, The Foldie

blocks.text: The Situation

While the U.S. market had been their initial focus, the founders knew they were missing opportunities in lucrative markets like the UK, Europe, and Australia. However, expanding internationally required more than just shipping products abroad—it demanded in-depth knowledge of global tax regulations, fraud prevention, and localized customer preferences. As a lean, founder-led operation, Thomas and Svéa also struggled to balance the demands of running their business with the complexities of scaling globally. They needed a partner like Reach, who could take on the operational and regulatory burden of international payments, freeing them to focus on what they did best—designing and selling great products.
The Solution

The Foldie partnered with Reach to unlock the advantage of their global Merchant of Record (MoR) model, enabling The Foldie to navigate the complexities of international ecommerce more efficiently. Through a no-code integration to their Shopify expansion stores, Reach took on the challenges of managing global payments, tax compliance, fraud prevention, and localized customer experience.
Strategic International Expansion
Simplified entry into key markets like the UK, Europe, and Australia with localized payments to maximize their conversions.
Simple & Comprehensive Compliance
Hassle-free compliance, as Reach took charge of international tax compliance, fraud prevention, and global payments.
Fast Implementation
A streamlined setup process that took just a few weeks, significantly faster than the founders anticipated.
Scalable Success
Increased volume and revenue as a result of an increased addressable global market and a reduction in international fees.

blocks.heading: The Outcome
blocks.text:
Conversion rates increased while customer complaints and chargebacks declined in Australia and the UK.

Within just a few months of implementing Reach's no-code Shopify integration, The Foldie achieved 10,000 orders in both the UK and Australia.

The Foldie offloaded complexity, lowered their international operational costs and freed up the founders to focus on scaling their brand.

Using an MoR, The Foldie was able to easily reallocate stock based on seasonal demand to increase their sales volume year-round.

meta.title: How The Foldie Scaled Global Success with Reach
meta.description: Discover how The Foldie partnered with Reach to unlock new international markets and achieve 10,000+ orders in both the UK and Australia within months of implementation.

blocks.text: The Situation

Ziella, a fast-growing direct-to-consumer ecommerce store under Protus Brands, specializes in thoughtfully curated gift sets. With demand spiking during seasonal periods—especially Q4—the team needed a reliable payments partner to scale. Ziella saw rapid growth, causing their previous payments solution to trigger holds on nearly 100% of incoming funds during their busiest time of year. This severely constrained cash flow and made it difficult to pay vendors, run ads, or even cover payroll.
The Solution
Within a few weeks, Ziella implemented Reach's Merchant of Record services, a decision driven by Reach's capacity to streamline global payment complexities. Key features of the solution included:
Transparent, Real-Time Support
Ziella's previous solution lacked direct communication and timely responses. Reach solved this by providing direct access to their team via Slack, ensuring quick and efficient issue resolution.
Stable, Scalable Payment System

Ziella, a rapidly growing brand, needed a payment platform that could handle fluctuating transaction volumes. Reach's solution provided the necessary infrastructure to process payments without revenue holds, enabling Ziella to capitalize on periods of high demand and plan for future growth.
Seamless Onboarding Experience
Reach delivered a fast, personalized, and frictionless onboarding process with clear documentation and hands-on support, ensuring a smooth transition and minimizing delays.
Ability to Launch into New Markets Without Delays
Reach provides the infrastructure and expertise to navigate international payments and compliance, enabling Ziella to launch into new EU markets with ease and confidence.

blocks.heading: The Outcome
blocks.text:
Scaling ad campaigns and responding to viral demand became possible without liquidity issues.

Seamless launches into new markets were possible with established infrastructure powered by Reach & completed with full compliance.

Improved support, transparency, and returns experience led to fewer chargeback disputes, with support from Reach.

By outsourcing their global payments solution, Ziella can focus on creativity and customer experience, not payments.
